message.content:
cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CL

The paper deals with automatic generation of video summaries of TV series, which involves modeling the dynamics of the plot and extracting relevant sequences. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including Multimedia (cs.MM), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Computer Vision (cs.CV), and Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). However, since the paper focuses on analyzing the social network of interactions between characters and using filmmaking grammar to generate character-oriented summaries, we believe that cs.MM and cs.IR are the most likely sub-categories. The use of machine learning and computer vision techniques is also mentioned, which supports the inclusion of cs.LG and cs.CV as likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves natural language processing to some extent, which suggests that cs.CL could also be a possible sub-category.
